input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.
Specifies, by IP address, the multicast group for which you want to display information.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">netsh routing ip igmp show grouptable</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${index}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> index=${index}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/bin/echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/bin/echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Shows the IGMP hosts group table for a multicast group. Used without parameters, show grouptable shows the IGMP hosts group tables once for all multicast groups on all interfaces associated with the router.
